Key Arguments: The legislation could stifle free speech and creative discussion.
Government censorship may not be the best solution to misinformation.
There is a risk of corruption by powerful corporations influencing narratives.
The complexity of truth and misinformation cannot be easily managed by a government agency.
The public should be trusted to self-censor and learn discernment.
Notable Quotes: The core of our democracy is to choose a voice that represents the people, not to censor and sue all other voices out of the picture.
Are we labelling Australia a democracy while distrusting the citizen to make informed decisions, navigate information or vote for that matter?
